column1: kai vaiyana mo tatakesikesiyako ki ’ito ka toki ki miyalrealre.
column2: I arrived at school at seven today.
column3: 我今天七點到學校。

column1: la ai kicakwanganai, sa modaane ko sinsinai ki takibolrobolrowa, ko pangcan kai taberanai la aminiya kawriva “’idiya! songalra!”
column2: It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”
column3: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」

column1: la akwadrawnai makanaelre sinsi “mwadringadringaiso amiya kawariva.
column2: We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”
column3: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」

column1: sa kicakwakwa nai, ko sinsinai la ’elaela naiya sinTaromakana wasi’i.
column2: In class, the teacher taught us the Rukai language of numbers.
column3: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。

column1: la to’a’arlanai wasi’i, ko sinsinai la ’elaela naiya ‘asenaya ki ’wasi’i.
column2: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.
column3: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。

column1: makalra kai kicekwaneli si la wathingalenganako sin Taromakana.
column2: I have learned many Rukai languages.
column3: 我學會好多族語。

column1: watwakesi yako tothadalrane, wakicakwako ki kwacalrilrisiyana tothadalrane, ai ’akilalrako ki tinali.
column2: I go to school every day, I learn the Rukai language every day, and I want to tell my mother.
column3: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。

column1: siya Kelesai ko naganeli.
column2: My name is Kelesai.
column3: 我的名字是Kelesai。

column1: siya Gaita ko nagane ki tamali.
column2: My dad’s name is Gaita.
column3: 我爸爸的名字是Gaita。

column1: siya Dolray ko nagane ki tinali.
column2: My mother’s name is Dolray.
column3: 我媽媽的名字是Dolray。

column1: kaiyasa tara mangealenga kai caylili.
column2: I am 10 years old.
column3: 我今年10歲。

column1: yakai ka tangea ka takali ka sawalay, siya Masegesege kai naganeini,tara mangealenga si eea kai cayli ini.
column2: I have a brother, his name is Masegesege, he is 11 years old.
column3: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Masegesege，他今年11歲。

column1: yakai nai tayangea ki tatakesikesiya twakesi.
column2: We study in the same school.
column3: 我們在同一間學校讀書。

column1: konako si takali ka sawalay madalame nai senay.
column2: Both my brother and I like to sing.
column3: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。

column1: madalamako langoy,lo taisadrasadraza maelrelre nai ka cekecekele mwa langolangoy.
column2: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.
column3: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。

column1: madalamako mathingathingale ki bawva ka talragi, la kalekete nai maelrelre senasenay si lwangolwangoy.
column2: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.
column3: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。

column1: lalakako ki so Taromake.
column2: I am an Taromake child.
column3: 我是魯凱族的小孩。

column1: ko daane nai yakai Taromake.
column2: Our family lives in Taromake.
column3: 我們家住在達魯瑪克。

column1: talima nai ka cekecekele.
column2: There are five people in our family.
column3: 我們家共有五個人。

column1: tatolro nai ka lamatakataka.
column2: There are three brothers and sisters in our family.
column3: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。

column1: konako si tama, tina, taka ka sawalay si taka ka ababay maelrelre nai.
column2: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.
column3: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。

column1: ko tamali ka mabelreng, kensase ko tamali.
column2: My father is tall and he is a policeman.
column3: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。

column1: marilay ko tinali, ko tinali ka ’ising.
column2: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.
column3: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。

column1: lo ikai daane ko tamali wa soTaromakana makawrivariva naiya.
column2: My father speaks the Rukai language with us at home.
column3: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。

column1: lo taisadrasadra ki kaladraidraza wa mobaliyo nai cekele.
column2: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.
column3: 我們暑假都會回部落。

column1: konako si latakali maelrelre nai mwa walra ina takolariyase.
column2: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.
column3: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。

column1: madalamako ki cekecekeleli.
column2: I like our family very much.
column3: 我很喜歡我們家的人。

column1: kai vaiya maelrelre ko ki tinali mwa kivaevang.
column2: I went out with my mother today.
column3: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。

column1: kai vaiyana masalese kai sobelebeleng, kadro makecelre kadro drangedrang, mangangerece kai sasevere.
column2: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.
column3: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。

column1: yakai nai ki tasiobola twakainene si kanekane mingpaw, kai vai ’asaelre ki kinaomasa nai masolra’ele ’aramoro.
column2: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.
column3: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。

column1: sa miyaobonga, madirele kai sobelebeleng.
column2: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.
column3: 下午，天空變紅了。

column1: la ki’elaelako ki tinali, asi madirerele kai sobelebeleng?
column2: I asked my mother why the sky is red.
column3: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。

column1: ko tinali kawriva laiya, ai kela kai masasevesevere.
column2: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.
column3: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。

column1: kai amaong kadrowa ka emeeme sobelebeleng, mwtalrivaivainga tariyaw.
column2: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.
column3: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。

column1: ai mobaliyo nai.
column2: We were going home too.
column3: 我們也要回家了。

column1: ikai kaelrea mobaliyo, sidramadramako ki tariyaw,
column2: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,
column3: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，

column1: anatoma la nikai kela kai masasevesevere, angielra kivaevang kidremedremeli.
column2: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.
column3: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。

column1: kai tatakesikesiyanai yakai thili ki naiyana, tothadalranako dadavace mwa tatakesikesiya, miya dadavace mobaliyo.
column2: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.
column3: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。

column1: kai tatakesikesiyanai kadro madraw, kadrowa ka takakalra ka takesikesi, mathingathingale nai makanaelre.
column2: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.
column3: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。

column1: konai ka lavavalake mokasa nai ikai ki dradralraza, la maelrelrenai angimalimali, si makawrivariva si masososo.
column2: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.
column3: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。

column1: ko lasinsi miya kiaelre naiya kivaevaevang, takamiya nai ka wacekecekele.
column2: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.
column3: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。

column1: tothadalranai swaswa’e, nikabola ki takibolrobolrowa nai amiyanai makanaelre.
column2: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.
column3: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。

column1: yakai ka tabere mwa mosakisakidri lribang, si kwadra ladroma ka tabere mwa swaswaswa’e daeda’e.
column2: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.
column3: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。

column1: wa swaswa’e nai asaelre ki laro’osonga ki tatakesikesiyanai, wa karathodo nai si mavalavala ina atomana, la kadelese tothadalrane kai tatakesikesiyanai.
column2: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.
column3: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。

column1: koza, mobaliyo nai ki cekelenai mwa ’olridraw ki tomoli.
column2: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.
column3: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。

column1: mawlainga kanai maceceele ki tomoli, mabarengerako ki tomoli.
column2: We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.
column3: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。

column1: sa ceele nakowa ki tomoli, ko tomoli ’asadalro nakwa ’oakane seika si ’wcia.
column2: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.
column3: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。

column1: malrimeme kai seika ki ’odroli ki tomoli, atengatenga mwadringai aramoro.
column2: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.
column3: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。

column1: miya madalamako kai ’wcia ki tomoli, miya ka mwadringai.
column2: I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.
column3: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。

column1: lo kodralridralriya, maelrelrako si kaingoli twaga kodralri.
column2: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.
column3: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。

column1: ko kaingoli twaga kodralri taleke, yakai sa kaang, tarokoko, taramonage si dingding.
column2: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.
column3: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。

column1: sa maka tokodralri, amwanai lacaceng ki laceng.
column2: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.
column3: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。

column1: ko kaingoli mala madromolro ka birasi, tay si rakiyo bay nakowa, amala iloko mobaliyo.
column2: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.
column3: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。

column1: si aokiyovagai lriniya, si mawriva ko bilrilanenga naw kela ’olridraw lriniya.
column2: I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.
column3: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。

column1: kai vaiyana ko sinsi iloko naiya mwa tala’ola’owa ki lagolagolay, yalangai nai sa kipo la tilribi nai ikai ki sawlatadra.
column2: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.
column3: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。

column1: sa modaanenga nai, ko sinsi laelraela naiya, “kai cocobonga ka lazazame, kai lrikodranga ka laolawlay, angikamaniyata ceele si siyavava.”
column2: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back
column3: so you can visit them yourself.""
column4: 進入動物園後，老師說:「前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。」

column1: mwakolodrako ki olawlay, amanisa nako kiyaomaw mwa ceele laolawlay.
column2: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.
column3: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。

column1: waceelako makalra azazame, yabeleng ki angato aniya’ala’alay, si waceelako loo yakai barongolo ’adring ki angato wa’e’ece.
column2: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.
column3: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。

column1: kai tala’ola’owa ki golagolay yakai ka zoo, baa si lrikolaw, nakowaceelana kai lagolagolay saiyana, kai vaiyana waceelanganako matiyakiraragai kidremedrameli.
column2: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.
column3: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。

column1: la sasiyasingako makalra ka sasing, ai bwaiyako ’aceele ki marodrawdrang.
column2: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.
column3: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。

column1: lo abilrilinga ai maelrelreako si marodraodrang anivalre kela.
column2: Next time I will come with my parents.
column3: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。

column1: kai taisadrasadra nai, tadrosa nai ka takali ka ababay si konako mwlrika’e ki agi ki tamali ikai Balangaw.
column2: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.
column3: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。

column1: mwbeleng kisiya nai twalai Taipake na kala Balrangaw.
column2: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.
column3: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。

column1: sa kelanganai Balrangaw, ko agi ki tamali ango sidosiya si kela kisiya kidreseng naiya.
column2: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.
column3: 到了台東，叔叔開車來火車站接我們。

column1: kadro wadayli kodaana ki gai ki tamali, ’lo angota sidosiya ’adalro wakelata.
column2: The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.
column3: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。

column1: kodaana ki agi ki tamali sa’agiyagisi yakai ka madraw ka tala’ola’owa ki golagolay, ango ’aliliding nai mwa tala’ola’owa ki golagolay.
column2: There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.
column3: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。

column1: ikainai iniya, ko agi ki tamali iloko naiya walomo bo’a’e si mobeleng ki baa.
column2: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.
column3: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。

column1: sa amaong, maelrelrenai mwa maci kwane sa aga.
column2: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.
column3: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。

column1: lo ikai maci makalra ka sidosiya, amanisa ango nai ’otobay mwa kawai.
column2: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.
column3: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。

column1: sa amwadadavace nai, la kidringai ’otobaiyanai ki’akotrakilinga, la mobelengnai baase si davace mobaliyo.
column2: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.
column3: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。

column1: wa mobaliyonganai kela Taipake kaiyasa, kadro thingale idra kidringainga ’otobay ki agi ki tamali amiyanai kidremedreme.
column2: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.
column3: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。

column1: sa lrolraina naiya takaikaiya so Taromake, si atwanaw takesiyana, lra mwsali Taicyo, tara ikai maci tacekecekelra.
column2: When we were young, our family lived in Taromake. After I started school, we moved to Taichung and have been living in the city ever since.
column3: 小時候我們家住在達魯瑪克，上學以後，就搬到了台中，一直在都市裡生活。

column1: na kelanga taikake, watakesiako eea ka takesi idra kakoza ki kacelisiya, athingale nakowa makaelraela kakoza ki kacalisiya so Taivang.
column2: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.
column3: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。

column1: amanisa, taisadrasadraza ki kaladraidraza, konako si takali ka sawalay mwbaliyowa cekeleli kielraelra lramarodrang, anatoma si alrecega yataka cekele kakozaneta.
column2: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.
column3: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。

column1: tara mavalolronga ka cayli ini kai marodrang, eene loceele takamaiya yacengeceng.
column2: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.
column3: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。

column1: lamani ko kielraelra idra wathingale taiya ka vagana, kali’ace ini sing Taromakana, miya maligilri swa Songaw, swa Talalibeka, swa Di’ong.
column2: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Taromak, as well as Bunun, Pinuyumayan and Japanese.
column3: 我問他會哪些語言，他的東魯凱語說得很流利，也會說布農語、卑南語和日本話。

column1: la kielraelrako kwani na akithingale nakowa, si sa lrolrainga wakicakwa ini vaga ki swa Di’ong, ko sakacekele ini ka swa Songaw, mathingathingale takalra swa Talalibeka ikai tatwlavalavaza ini, amanisa malalekete kawriva makalra ka makaelraelra vagana.
column2: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Bunun, and he knows many Pinuyumayan at work, so he can speak so many languages.
column3: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是布農族人，而他工作上認識許多卑南族人，所以他會說這麼多語言。

column1: lo tamasososo sakibolobolo nai,ko marodrang elraelraelra makalra kwadra sininadroma lrigila ki alro’o.
column2: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.
column3: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。

column1: eene odrava lo kadrowa makathingale kidremedreme nai, la ni arakaiya nai ki soci rako’ing, lai kalalekete nai kilalra twadriyadringai.
column2: Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.
column3: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。

column1: sa lrolrainganako nako thingale kakoza ki cekeleta, maininoako ki sw kwacalisiya.
column2: When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.
column3: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。

column1: sa wathingale arokakalra, lo kidremedremeli sw Taromakako ka nikalrivala, miya ka anikamiya.
column2: The more I know, the more I feel that being a Taromak is unique and something to be proud of.
column3: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為東魯凱族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。

column1: lo amiyaobo, ai mwbaliyo ko agili ka sawalay.
column2: My younger brother is going home this evening.
column3: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。

column1: konako si kaingoli amwa nai maci langai sa tarokoko, adolro kwaobo ka mwadringai akane ki agili ka sawalay.
column2: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.
column3: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。

column1: sa lribate nai talacenga, ikai talacenga yakai ka makala ka ngetangeta ka laceng.
column2: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.
column3: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。

column1: walangai nai sa ’incai, bakway si ningiging.
column2: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.
column3: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。

column1: kwani tawki ka thilri tiyang ka kilrangai sa madro mawriva matikaikay amiya, “malrimeme kai angodraleli si vinwate obawbala. lwangai’a kobekela!”
column2: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”
column3: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」

column1: la langai nai angodrale si vinwate obawbala.
column2: We bought pineapples and peaches.
column3: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。

column1: sa lribate nai kai tiyang ka kilrangai sa botolo, la mawriva tawki matikay, “ai langai sa manema? kaivaiyana madraw si karocolo kai tarokoko, tolro ka idai ka ’aiso ka eea.”
column2: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”
column3: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」

column1: lo miniya ka makocingalre aramoro kidremedreme ki kaingoli, si kielraelra tawki kalekete ma’adolro kobekela.
column2: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.
column3: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。

column1: la kwani tawki tobale nai amiya ma’adodolronga, kai kalekete ’oda’eda’e ’aiso laiya.
column2: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.
column3: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。

column1: kodra yathili ka tawki la dawdawdaw, nyama lwangai’a kaangeli, madraw si ma’adolro laiya.
column2: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.
column3: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。

column1: sabilrilanenga walangai nai tarokoko si kaang mwdaane twaga asiyaete ki too.
column2: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
column3: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。

column1: maolai nai kiya lalavalava si madralemedremenga.
column2: After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.
column3: 等了好久，天已經黑了。

column1: la ki’adrelre agili nakowa mawriva matikay, atwanaw kanai isasadra swa sivwtai, naw mwbaliyako lo elra taisadrasadraza.
column2: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.
column3: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。

column1: ko kaingoli mawriva amiyaikay twaganga ko taleke, mwa dawlo lrakay takane’a!
column2: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!
column3: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!

column1: la dawdawlo nai ki lraretesa si lratalagi, akela maelele mita akiso’ili kane kwaobo ka taleke.
column2: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.
column3: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。

column1: yakai yako tangea ka tabereli sya Kecelre, tara karimoro iloko ini lamanema.
column2: I have a classmate named Kecelre, he often forgets to bring things.
column3: 我有一個同學叫Kecelre，他常常忘記帶東西。

column1: lo kibolobolo nai, kwani wakisalro latabere idra cingpi, samosakisakidra si ciywming.
column2: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.
column3: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。

column1: angivale, angi’osale, angitolrolo, akisalro iniya makanaelre.
column2: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.
column3: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。

column1: amanisa, yakai ka malisi iyaiyaiya ini, tara wakisalro si kai sawli.
column2: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.
column3: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。

column1: sabilrilanenga kadro kiaomaw makanaelre akisalro iniya.
column2: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.
column3: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。

column1: yakai sa makavale,kota ka makanaelre maedede mwa kivaevang.
column2: One day, we all went on an outing together.
column3: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。

column1: ikai kaelrelrea yowata, Kecelre ai mwa laang,si karimoro iloko weysengce.
column2: On the way, Kecelre wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.
column3: 路途中，Kecelre想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。

column1: la kwani wakisalro weysengce ki latabere, si konai ka makanaelre tobalre iniya amiyaikay, miyaliyako kadrowa iloko laiya.
column2: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.
column3: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。

column1: la kasasibolo tobitobi Kecelre, si kalisi mawriva amiyaikay ,asi kai akisalro weysengce nakowa makanaelre!
column2: Kecelre burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!
column3: Kecelre急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!!

column1: lamani ko latabere elraelra iniya, asiloiya kaso ilokoiyasono, lo akisalro moswa lamanema, kadrwy sawli!
column2: The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!
column3: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!

column1: lo azana, mwlalakese ko Kecelre asabale kelanga baolo, na sawli lamanema idra wakisalro ini ki latabere.
column2: The next day at school, Kecelre arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.
column3: 隔天上學，Kecelre很早就到學校了，Kecelre把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。

column1: ’ayy amoliyaili laiya ko Kecelre ki latabere, wathingalenganako laiya si loiganenga ai angiyailokako ,si kiyaseaseng ki latabere owakaene akisalro iniya lamanema.
column2: Kecelre apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.
column3: Kecelre向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。

column1: ko tamali ka tara ana’ana yata ka cekele.
column2: My dad is a hunter of the tribe.
column3: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。

column1: sa lrolainganako, ko tamali si agiini wadavace lo amaong, wailoko dra labo bakalre si kwang.
column2: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.
column3: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。

column1: lo lredranga, lai wailoko lini swalro’o mobaliyo.
column2: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.
column3: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。

column1: yakailo baboy, yakailo ravare, nadroma miyakai sadamatha.
column2: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.
column3: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。

column1: kolini avalavalanga swalro’o ikai tamwadriadringa ki cekele, akiso’ili sakacekele.
column2: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.
column3: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。

column1: loiya makavalazako ki tamali, ai to’alra tamali alro’o.
column2: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.
column3: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。

column1: ko tamali mawriva amiyaikay, lo kadrawnga so naw iloko mosowa.
column2: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.
column3: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。

column1: ko sawalai ki cekele yakailo arakai tokolro ’aana, wadare’elini thelrece si taene.
column2: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.
column3: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。

column1: ko tamali ka malrigili dare’e thelrece, si mawriva amiyaikay, kaivai ka sarakaiya wala sadamatha, ai caceela si kilralibaka nai idra taodra’ala ki waodriodri’i, ai drakale nai tokolro ikai talranelriniya.
column2: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.
column3: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

column1: alrolrodo kalralekete kirarokodro to’alra ki lratamatama alro’o, tothadalanako kicakwa dare’e tokolro, ’adalo wa’ana tokolroli.
column2: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.
column3: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。

column1: la ceele ko tamali mawriva nakowa amiyaikay, lobibilrili ai mwelra tino tara ana’ana si malrigili so.
column2: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.
column3: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。

column1: kaiyasa madrawnganako,waelraiyako kwadra boo si lraylili,to’a’alra tamali alro’o.
column2: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.
column3: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。

column1: kainganai avalavala si akiso’ili swalro’o ki sakacekele.
column2: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.
column3: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。

column1: ko tamali elraelra amiyaikay, konai ai kiyaseasengta sa sobolobolo ki lratomoita, la ataromara makala ka swalro’o.
column2: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.
column3: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。

column1: kai miyalrealre abilrilinganako mwa twakesi.
column2: I was late for school this morning.
column3: 我早上上學遲到了。

column1: samwako ki tatakesikesiya, la karimorako iloko ina labaceli.
column2: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
column3: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。

column1: la kainako wailoko sa manemanenga.
column2: I didn’t bring anything with me.
column3: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。

column1: sa takesikesinai, konako si sataberaneli la mokasanai ceele ki ’acase.
column2: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.
column3: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。

column1: sa sikingnai, kai sataberaneli la ’akisalro nakowa ’inpici si samosakisakidra.
column2: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.
column3: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。

column1: ko singsinai la iniya kawriva nakwa, “loelanga molalakesa angidrakale, kai abilribilrilinga !”
column2: The teacher told me, “Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!”
column3: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」

column1: ko talragili siya ’Alri, miya lalake ki Ngodradrekai.
column2: My good friend’s name is Alri, and he is also an Rukai child.
column3: 我的好朋友叫Alri，他也是魯凱族的小孩。

column1: wamaelrelrenai ikai ki cekelenai Taromak twakesikesi.
column2: We study together in the Taromak tribe.
column3: 我們一起在Taromak部落讀書。

column1: tara maelrelrenai kilalalra ki tarwarodrang lo tomaowlawlay, miya malrigilinai sinTaromakakaana.
column2: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Rukai proficiently.
column3: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說東魯凱語。

column1: mabelrengako si kabitolro, ko ’Alri malebe si karilai.
column2: I am tall and overweight, while Alri is short and thin.
column3: 我很高也很胖，Alri很矮也很瘦。

column1: ko ’Alri wa’ararakenga, madalamenai makanaelre ki iniya.
column2: Alri is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.
column3: Alri很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。

column1: Kaivaiyana ’ongdokai tatakesikesiya, makarakara makalra ikai tatakesikesiya.
column2: Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.
column3: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。

column1: yakai ka mabilibilibili sakakereng, ti’iti’isi mali, lrabwale, malikasaw si lraylrayli.
column2: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
column3: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。

column1: makarakara ako lrabwale.
column2: I participated in the running competition.
column3: 我比賽跑步。

column1: salrabwale ako, moarairay ako, acolro twaerairay sa makalra.
column2: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.
column3: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。

column1: amanisa angidrakale ako, twsatamiya a’otalicobong lrabwale.
column2: But I stood up and continued running forward.
column3: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。

column1: sa danolako kainganai kai laomase wakiaragai.
column2: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.
column3: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。

column1: ene kadro ako amalra sa mwsakaeea, amanisa kiaragai ako, asilwiya danolako makarakara.
column2: Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.
column3: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。

column1: koza konako si tamali amwanai lika’e agi tamali ka sawalay.
column2: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.
column3: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。

column1: madola dra’ale agi ki tamali ka sawalay.
column2: My uncle injured his foot.
column3: 叔叔的腳受傷了。

column1: kwani elaela naiya , daane calraviya matrabelrang eea ka barongolo
column2: He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.
column3: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。

column1: kwani sa ’odringadringi calraviya, twalai calravaya mocili mwdaedae.
column2: He fell off the roof while repairing it.
column3: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。

column1: tamali wailoko bwate ki goong si sabiki baai ki agi ki tamali ka sawalay.
column2: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.
column3: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。

column1: konako si agi ki tamale ka sawaly ikai daane masosososo. Kawni akiso’ili sa makalra maolai
column2: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.
column3: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。

column1: sa aikiovagaizako, agi tamali ka sawalay osamalra nakoa mabelengnga , si haro aniomasa miya.
column2: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.
column3: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。

column1: la kawrivako, “nama ai adravako dra’aleso modringainga, lo ela niyamanga naiyana kivaevang.”
column2: I said, “When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us.”
column3: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」

column1: 2022 ka cayli, sihe dawlo kaigi athorokai lakacalisiya nibongsiyo kalalekete teasikatha kacalisiyana wacase nagane ikai belenge.
column2: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.
column3: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。

column1: kielaela ako anisikalralenga kisana kecengana malra “teasikatha sinagane kwacalisiyana” yakai cekele ki mwkathabara ka Cegaw.
column2: I interviewed Noami Kulas, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.
column3: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Cegaw。

column1: konako si kwani makaketeketenai kikai niciyo mwaliniyana homong.
column2: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.
column3: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。

column1: ikai tahomongnga. aiya nakoa elaela tatwalaza acoga ki naganeini. tako iloko nakwa athingale cekecekeleini, si cekeleini.
column2: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.
column3: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。

column1: la kielaela ako asorakedre aela ki nagane, malisi koani sw’ili ta’acasa?
column2: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn't the old registration method sufficient?
column3: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?

column1: la kawriva nakwa, lo arakai lrawtiyatiya kadroi kalalekete mwa’ahoa ’elaela acoga ki nagane, kai droma ka omase arakai “Ce syngseng” la asolwkai kimacacava.
column2: He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him Na Xian Sheng
column3: which resulted in many jokes being made.
column4: 他對我說，因為用中文字並不能準確的傳達他的名字，其他人還會叫他「Ce先生」，也因此鬧出不少笑話。

column1: Cegaw la kawriva, “koacalisiyana wa’acase ’onagane atengatenga ahoa. naganeli ka daihiyo yanai swmanema kacalisiya, yanai ka cekecekele, yanai ka loloda, anatomasi arotakalra kai laretesa malra sawli naganelini.”
column2: Noami Kulas said, The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group
column3: our family
column4: our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.""
column5: Cegaw說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

column1: koza konako si kaingo amwanai iciba taikaiya thakathakai, ko kaingo iloko sa makalra ’odrolini laceng mwa, watwairoa moadriadringai kacalisiya akanea baai ki laomase.
column2: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.
column3: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。

column1: madalame makanaelre taikaiya thakathakai ki kaingo, takalra ka omase walangai ki tavangolo si rasease, takalra ka omase kela ’alavalava againi airo’a.
column2: Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.
column3: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。

column1: twairo’a maongo si tobinereberese moadringai aramoro, lamani niakama bwate ki baboy, tasabaliyana kiakadalame takalra ki bazabaza, kela makanaelre tilibi.
column2: The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.
column3: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米非常好吃，還有烤山豬肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來排隊。

column1: lowagaga ko kaingo, yakayako thili aiaidi ki bazabaza. yakaiyako thili akwadraw tawtaw, “’odrolinai kaivai laceng kadroa ni’osababo, imiya loangai!”
column2: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, The vegetables are self-grown
column3: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!""
column4: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」

column1: akase mwlangai lamanemanenai lre’eng, ko kaingo amiyaikai, “yakaiso ’osakaelre kikai lakwani”
column2: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, It's all thanks to your help.""
column3: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」

column1: kavai tamasikaikaita, kicakwako matikai ki kacalisiya racave si akanekanea kodra ki ligila, si kiabalra ako tikaiya thakathakai lamanema kiadolro aramoro.
column2: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.
column3: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。

column1: celeako ki kaingo madralame ki sinikadroma kanekaneta, konako ’acoco’o si maesai kiragai aramoro tamiyaneli.
column2: Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
column3: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
